title: Extends the authority of the city of Yonkers to impose a mortgage recording tax
summary: Extends the authority of the city of Yonkers to impose a mortgage recording tax.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2462

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PRETLOW, SPANO -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to extending the expiration  of
         the mortgage recording tax imposed by the city of Yonkers

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 253-d of the tax law,  as  amended
    2  by chapter 142 of the laws of 2010, is amended to read as follows:
    3    1.  The city of Yonkers, acting through its local legislative body, is
    4  hereby authorized and empowered to adopt and amend local  laws  imposing
    5  in  any  such city during the period beginning September first, nineteen
    6  hundred ninety-three and ending August thirty-first, two thousand [elev-
    7  en] THIRTEEN, a tax of fifty cents for each one hundred dollars and each
    8  remaining major fraction thereof of principal debt or  obligation  which
    9  is  or  under  any  contingency  may be secured at the date of execution
   10  thereof, or at any time thereafter, by a mortgage on real property situ-
   11  ated within such city and recorded on or after the date upon which  such
   12  tax  takes effect and a tax of fifty cents on such mortgage if the prin-
   13  cipal debt or obligation which is or by any contingency may  be  secured
   14  by such mortgage is less than one hundred dollars.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03229-01-1
